alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, northwestern Richmond, south central Westmoreland and central Essex Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 628 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Loretto to near Champlain to Newtown. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Champlain around 635 PM EDT. Newland around 645 PM EDT. Tappahannock around 700 PM EDT. Warsaw around 715 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Beazley, Wellford, Ethel, Owenton, Threeway, Hustle, Elevon, Mount Holly, Rexburg and Oldhams. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Richmond; Western Essex; Western King and Queen; Westmoreland
